onRetrieveDisplayObjects

public void onRetrieveDisplayObjects()
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
This is the place where the derived class should set its layout, extract all widgets which require a further customization and store them as instance attributes. This method is invoked only once during the entity life cycle.

The method is invoked:

  • for an Activity, during the Activity#onCreate() execution, after the parent Activity#onCreate() method has been invoked ;
  • for an Fragment, during the Fragment#onCreate() execution, after the parent Fragment#onCreate() method has been invoked.

It is ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread!

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onRetrieveDisplayObjects in interface LifeCycle

onBusinessObjectsRetrieved

public void onBusinessObjectsRetrieved()
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
This is the typical callback that will be invoked every time the business objects have been retrieved, just after the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method has successfully completed, i.e. no LifeCycle.BusinessObjectUnavailableException exception has been thrown. It is strongly advised not to modify the GUI during this method execution.

It is NOT ensured that this method will be invoked from the UI thread! If the Activity implements the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface, this method will be invoked from a (high-priority) worker thread.

Never invoke this method, only the framework should, because this is a callback!

Specified by:
onBusinessObjectsRetrieved in interface LifeCycle

public final boolean isInteracting()
Description copied from interface: AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Provides information about the current entity life cycle.

It is very handy when it comes to know whether the end-user can interact with the underlying Activity/Fragment entity.

Specified by:
isInteracting in interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Returns:
true if and only if the underlying Activity/Fragment entity life-cycle is between the Activity.onResume()/Fragment.onResume() and Activity.onPause()/Fragment.onPause() methods

getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount

public final int getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount()
Description copied from interface: AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Enables to know how many times the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has been invoked, which may be useful when you do not want this method to do something that the LifeCycle.onFulfillDisplayObjects() method may have already done.

Specified by:
getOnSynchronizeDisplayObjectsCount in interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Returns:
the number of time the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method has actually been invoked

shouldKeepOn

public final boolean shouldKeepOn()
Indicates whether nothing went wrong during the implementing entity, or if a redirection is being processed.

Thanks to the redirection controller, it is possible to re-route any Smartable Activity when it starts, if some other Activity needs to be executed beforehand.

Returns:
true if and only if the implementing Activity/@{link android.app.Fragment} entity should resume its execution

public final AggregateClass getAggregate()
Description copied from interface: Smarted
Gives access to the entity underlying "aggregate" object.

This "aggregate" is especially useful to provide data to the entity, and is typically used by the ActivityController.Interceptor through the entity life cycle events.

registerBroadcastListeners

public final void registerBroadcastListeners(AppPublics.BroadcastListener[] broadcastListeners)
Description copied from interface: Smarted
Explicitly registers some wrapped broadcast receivers for the Activity/Fragment entity. This method is especially useful to declare and consume at the same place broadcast intents.

Those receivers will finally be unregistered by the Activity.onDestroy()/Fragment.onDestroy() method.

When invoking that method, all previously registered listeners via the AppPublics.BroadcastListenerProvider or AppPublics.BroadcastListenersProvider are kept, and the new provided ones are added.

Specified by:
registerBroadcastListeners in interface Smarted<AggregateClass>
Parameters:
broadcastListeners - the wrapped receivers to registers

getMenuCommands

public java.util.List<StaticMenuCommand> getMenuCommands()
Description copied from interface: Smarted
This callback will be invoked by the framework, so as to discover how the entity contributes to the Android menu system.

Specified by:
getMenuCommands in interface Smarted<AggregateClass>
Returns:
all the static menu commands that the activity wants to make available ; may return null, and in that case, this entity will not expose any menu entry

onException

public final void onException(java.lang.Throwable throwable,
                              boolean fromGuiThread)
Description copied from interface: Smarted
This is a centralized method which will be invoked by the framework any time an exception is thrown by the entity.

It may be also invoked from the implementing entity, when an exception is thrown, so that the ActivityController.ExceptionHandler handles it.

Specified by:
onException in interface Smarted<AggregateClass>
fromGuiThread - indicates whether the call is done from the GUI thread

isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

public boolean isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay()
Description copied from interface: AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Indicates whether the extending Activity/Fragment entity also implementing the LifeCycle interface is in the middle of a LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) call.

It is very handy when it comes to disable certain things, like menu entries, while an Activity is loading.

Specified by:
isRefreshingBusinessObjectsAndDisplay in interface AppPublics.LifeCyclePublic
Returns:
true if and only if the LifeCycle#refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable) is being executed.

Same as invoking #refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, null, false).

See Also:
refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean, Runnable, boolean)

refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay

public final void refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay(boolean retrieveBusinessObjects,
                                                   java.lang.Runnable onOver,
                                                   boolean immediately)
Description copied from interface: LifeCycle
Asks the implementing entity to reload its business objects and to synchronize its display. The method invokes the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method and then, provided the previous call was successful, the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method.

It must be invoked only from the UI thread, if the current interface does not implement the LifeCycle.BusinessObjectsRetrievalAsynchronousPolicy interface.

Specified by:
refreshBusinessObjectsAndDisplay in interface LifeCycle
Parameters:
retrieveBusinessObjects - indicates whether the LifeCycle.onRetrieveBusinessObjects() method should be invoked or not
onOver - if not null, this method will be eventually invoked from the UI thread, once the LifeCycle.onSynchronizeDisplayObjects() method execution has successfully completed
immediately - if this flag is set to true, even if the implementing entity is not currently displayed, the execution will be run at once. If set to false, the execution will be delayed until the entity (Activity.onResume() for the Activity, Fragment.onResume() for the Fragment method is invoked
